links.title: Bigfry's Blog
links.description: Did you know that American options and European options differ in that American options can be exercised anytime before the expiration date, whereas European options can only be exercised at the expiration date? This means European options are cheaper than American options because American options have more options (pun intended).

How Do Fitbit's Versa, Ace Stack Up Against Competitors? https://benzinga.com/z/11367533 $FIT $AAPL $GRMN

links.title: How Do Fitbit's Versa, Ace Stack Up Against Competitors? (NYSE:FIT)
links.description: Time is up for Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Garmin Ltd. (NASDAQ: GRMN)'s reign over the smartwatch market. Fitbit Inc (NYSE: FIT)'s new Versa and Ace are expected to begin poaching share when they hit shelves this spring. Fitbit's waterproof Versa is said to be the lightest smartwatch on the U.S.

links.title: How Apple Inc. (AAPL) Can Spend Its $163 Billion Cash Hoard
links.description: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has a $163 billion problem. That problem, specifically, is how to spend such a large amount of money. Most companies would probably go out and make a major acquisition, but that would be out of character for Apple.

Learn about Volatility Drag, Leveraged ETFS, and Risk Tolerance https://bigfrysblog.wordpress.com/volatility-drag-leveraged-etfs-and-risk-tolerance/

links.title: Volatility Drag, Leveraged ETFS, and Risk Tolerance
links.description: Image source: http://the7circles.uk/sequencing-risk-pound-cost-ravaging/ You start with $100 and you lose 1% of your account, then you gain 1% of your account. Repeat this process many, many times, and you will have $0. If you've heard about leveraged ETFs, then you probably know about volatility drag and what it can do to the price of leveraged ETFS....
